content: [Applause]
okay I have not done this in quite a while hey guys welcome back to
Blackmagic craft this is gonna be a pretty different episode this week but

haven't run a game of D&D in quite some time I was running a long long campaign
that lasted over two years that went really good it was great but it kind of
ran its course and took a little bit of a break and I restarted a new campaign
last year with a slightly different and smaller group it didn't really work out
too well I mean it was fine but it just kind of fizzled out and never really
happened one of the things I had done when starting that new group was to
reduce the player size down to four people because running a game for D&D
with only four players is really nice it gives everybody a lot of time for their
turns it's easier to manage and overall it just works really well it has a huge
flaw if you only have four players and then one or two of them can't make it on
game night you have no game it's just what I'm gonna do running the game for
two people and me and my friends my groups we're not you know young people
with time on our hands we all have careers we have families we have kids so
organizing these games takes a lot of effort a lot of time people have to get
childcare so if you organize one game every month and then one or two people
have to cancel it's a real bummer and we kind of just stopped playing and I moved
on to other games to fill the void but gosh dang it
want to start running D&D again so this is my idea before I plan how to session
what if I totally changed the way I look at running a game and instead of running

little one-shot one or two session adventures with a large player pool that
could function as a drop-in so I actually got to gather people for both
my groups and a few other new people and I formed a group of seven players
there's no big huge epic story it's just seven characters who are all part of
some sort of guild or mercenary group or whatever that each session sets out to
fix some problem or go on some little mission and the idea here is that not
all seven people come at the same time that you know there's always going to be
a couple people that are busy but it always guarantees that you probably have
at least four or five people to play with my fear is that what can happen is
that there's gonna be a lot of times that all seven people show up and then
it's going to be pretty crazy to run and sit at this little table I really got to
